unnormalised: **Telecom Boost: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: telecom boost colon fiber to home expansion gains momentum across india

unnormalised: New Delhi, India â€“ The rollout of Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) infrastructure is accelerating nationwide, promising faster and more reliable internet connectivity for homes and businesses. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel continue to aggressively expand their fiber optic networks, particularly in Tier II and Tier III cities.

unnormalised: Industry analysts at IIM Ahmedabad predict that FTTH subscriptions will surge by 30% in the next fiscal year. This growth is fueled by increasing demand for bandwidth-intensive applications like streaming services and online education, particularly after the success of films like "RRR" highlighted the importance of high-quality visual experiences.

unnormalised: BSNL, although facing challenges, is also committed to upgrading its existing infrastructure to FTTH across 60,000 km. Their efforts are focused on providing affordable broadband access to rural areas. The overall investment in FTTH infrastructure is estimated to reach Rs. 20,000 Crores in the next 2 years, paving the way for a digitally empowered India. Experts believe this expansion will significantly boost economic activity and improve the quality of life for millions.
